11511.content:
"Behold! Our solution!"

Lucy was met by unimpressed stares. The celestial mage sighed as she put down the box on the table. She'd expected... more of a reaction. Actually, any kind of reaction.

It was Lisanna who spoke up first, "Um, they're nice?"

"Don't patronize me." She sighed loudly.

"Juvia thinks they look like normal candies." The other visitor remarked. It was only the three of them, sitting inside Lucy's apartment, "Are they special, somehow?"

True enough, the small box in front of them contained several round candies, around the size of a ping pong ball. The sugary coating shined in the light. Lucy almost let out a wail of despair, having worked on them for a long time and expecting more enthusiasm.

Instead, she tried to explain, "Right, so, we all know why we're here. Right?"

"To beat Erza in the upcoming duel. There's no way we can take her on by ourselves, so you mentioned knowing of an item that could help us." Lisanna recalled.

Juvia nodded her agreement, "Because if we lose, we'll have to be her servants for an entire day."

"I still can't believe we somehow agreed to that bet." Lucy grumbled quietly, "Anyway, that's right. Erza is an absolute monster, not to mention has more magical power and strength than us, so I've been looking for a solution in the guild's library. That's where I found this!"

She pulled out a worn, leather-wrapped book and placed it on the table; next to the box. Its cover was rough and clearly old, but the Fairy Tail symbol was still proudly emblazoned on the front. Even the pages seemed to be a light shade of yellow already.

"A book?"

Lucy smirked, "Not just any book. This is one of the first master's alchemy tomes."

That got her a response from the others. Lisanna blinked in awe, while their water mage openly gaped; both of them were shocked by her discovery.

"You found one of master Mavis' works?!" Lisanna asked.

"Yup! It was hidden away on some shelf in the back of the library, where I usually go to in order to look up subjects for my own literary projects." She revealed. It had been a lucky and coincidental find, but Lucy wasn't going to say that, "I took it back home and looked up magical strength enhancers.

Understanding dawned on Juvia, "You mean the candies!"

"Yeah! Master Mavis had written down instructions to make these enhancers, but funnily enough they turned out to be candies. Well, they still work as intended -- or at least I hope so."

Making the candies hadn't been easy. The recipe was complicated, and the ingredients had been so rare that she'd been forced to visit a herb specialist outside of town, which costed her a lot of money. Needless to say, this had been a costly endeavor.

But Lucy was certain that the candies were ready. She'd followed the instructions to the letter, mixing the various ingredients and turning them into the candy products that were currently presented.

This box only contained a few of the total amount of candies she'd made. There were multiple batches left, stored away in her apartment.

"So, what do they do exactly?" Lisanna inquired curiously.

"According to master Mavis, the candies increase both your physical strength and your magical energy reserves. Don't know if it's permanent, but it should give us a boost." Lucy answered truthfully, "At least enough to stand a chance against Erza."

"Juvia thinks we should try them out!" The blue-haired beauty smiled.

Lisanna shrugged, "Can't hurt to try, I suppose."

"Don't worry, girls. I'll go first." She already had a candy in her hand, preparing herself for what was to come.

Without further ado, Lucy chomped down on the candy, wondering how well it would work.
11511.title: She's made special candies to buff up
